page.title: 13MOLESEY CARNIVAL
page.content: Molesey Carnival has been a regular event for many years. It starts just after midday and is always on the first Saturday in June. In 1985 the Molesey Carnival fell on June 1st. The police stop all traffic in Walton Road a few minutes before the carnival begins. It is always led by the Mayor of Elmbridge and his children and sometimes a few friends. Next is always a band followed by the first float. This carries the Carnival Queen. Then come an assortment of floats entered by local shops, pubs and groups. There are always many other people on foot dressed up in various disguises. The procession makes it's way along Walton Road to the recreation ground where there are stalls and sideshows.
